revision.text: Possibly: The apologies of Justin Martyr, Tertullian, and Minutius Felix. In defence of the Christian religion with the commonitory of Vincentius Lirinensis, concerning the primitive rule of faith translated from their originals: with notes, for the advantage chiefly of English readers, and a preliminary discourse upon each author. Together with a prefatory dissertation about the right use of the fathers. By William Reeves, M.A. rector of Craneford in Middlesex. In two volumes. (London : Printed by T.W. and T.S. for J Churchill, at the Black-Swan in Pater-Noster-Row, 1716). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2398229~S1
